p: Finally, systematic sampling, i.e., good spatial coverage and sufficient longitudinal follow-ups, is key for the determination of the distribution ranges conduciveness of climatic conditions for Ae. albopictus. Currently, systematic survey data on Ae. albopictus are only available for four provinces in China [ 39– 42]. Although China’s Center for Disease Control and Prevention has implemented a cross-country surveillance system and conducted longitudinal surveys, the spatial coverage is too coarse for a comprehensive nationwide evaluation of Ae. albopictus distribution [ 6, 23]. June–September is an important season for mosquito population dynamics monitoring, based on the results of this study. We emphasize that both spatial coverage and sampling seasons are essential for determining the northern geographic margins of distribution of the vector.
